raw_text:
Lib Dems predict 'best ever poll'
 
 The Lib Dems are set for their best results in both the general election and the local council polls, one of their frontbenchers has predicted.
 
 Local government spokesman Ed Davey was speaking as the party launched its campaign for the local elections being held in 37 English council areas. The flagship pledge is to replace council tax with a local income tax. The Tories say the Lib Dems would make people pay more tax and Labour says the party's sums do not add up. Looking to the coming elections, which are all expected to be held on 5 May, Mr Davey said: "We are going to be winning more votes and winning more seats. "I think we are going to have the best general election results and local election results we have ever had under [party leader] Charles Kennedy. "I couldn't think of a stronger endorsement of a leader."
llama3.2:1b: The Liberal Democrats are set for their best-ever results in both local council polls, with one frontbench member predicting they will win more votes and seats.
The party's general election campaign is launching on 5 May, with a flagship pledge to replace council tax with a local income tax.
llama3.2:3b: Liberal Democrats predict their best-ever poll in both general election and local council elections, with Ed Davey predicting wins of more votes and seats, calling it an "endorsement" of party leader Charles Kennedy's leadership.
gemma2:2b: The Liberal Democrats predict their best-ever performance in both the general election and local council elections, according to Ed Davey, a frontbench spokesman.
Their campaign centers on replacing council tax with a local income tax.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Lib Dems expect their best results in both the general election and local council polls, with Ed Davey stating they are expected to win more votes and seats compared to other parties.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Lib Dems predict major political success, saying they will win more votes and seats in both national and local elections on May 5th, based on their plans to replace council tax with income-based taxes under new party leader Charles Kennedy.
qwen2.5:3b: Lib Dems predict their best-ever poll results in both general and local council elections, led by Ed Davey as Local Government spokesman.
Their main pledge is replacing council tax with a local income tax.
Tories claim increased taxation while Labour doubts the party's calculations.
Davey asserts the Lib Dems will win more seats and votes, calling it Charles Kennedy’s strongest endorsement yet.

I think we are going to have the best general election results and local election results we have ever had under Charles Kennedy.

Local government spokesman Ed Davey predicted that the Lib Dems would win more votes and win more seats in local council elections than any previous party.
The Lib Dems have promised to replace council tax with a local income tax, which is seen as unpopular by Labour voters.

He added that Labour's promises to replace council tax with a local income tax were "stronger" than ever before.

The Tory group expects Lib Dems to make people pay more, while Labour says their figures are incorrect.
Davey believes Lib Dems will win more votes and seats, claiming they'll have the best general election results ever under Charles Kennedy.
tinyllama:1.1b: According to Lib Dem spokesperson Ed Davey, the party is set for their best results in both the local council poll and general election, according to predictions made during the launch of their campaign for the elections.
The flagship plea of the party to replace council tax with a local income tax is expected to make people pay more tax, but the Conservatives have criticized the Lib Dems' numbers.
Mr Davey emphasizes that the party is projected to win more votes and seats than in previous elections under the party leader Charles Kennedy.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Liberal Democrats predict they will make the best gains in both elections, according to their frontbench spokesperson Ed Davey.
The party's announcement comes as it launches its local government campaign, with a focus on replacing council tax with a local income tax.
In addition, the Tories argue that the Lib Dems are not adding up, while Labour maintains they would impose higher taxes.
With elections slated for May 5th, Mr. Davey believes his party will do better than ever before.

The Conservatives argue this would lead to an increase in taxes, while Labour claims that the party's finances do not add up.

They aim to replace council tax with a local income tax, which has raised concerns from the Tories, Labour, and other parties about it being too high for some individuals.
The upcoming elections on May 5th are expected to yield even better results than previously anticipated.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Lib Dem frontbencher Ed Davey anticipates the party's finest general election and local council poll victories yet, attributing this optimism to their new pledge: replacing council tax with a local income tax.
The Conservatives criticize the Lib Dems for increasing taxes, while Labour dismisses their budget projections as unfeasible.
Davey confidently forecasts enhanced votes and seats in the forthcoming 5 May elections under party leader Charles Kennedy's leadership, presenting this as a robust endorsement of Kennedy.
